body:
From a discussion in person:

- the current 'is flutter module' check will incorrectly think that dart modules, in a project that is using a flutter sdk, are flutter modules
- we should consider additionally seeing if there is a pubspec, and if so, parse it to see if it is using flutter. If not, we can reject. We'd want to make sure the parse is performant.
- this modification to the check would need to be done in the flutter and dart plugins

@jwren, @alexander-doroshko, does this accurately capture the conversation?

comment_data.body:
Yes, I think so. If we think we need it at all (as SDK remains per project, not per module).
Implementation in the Dart plugin only (reused in Flutter) sounds sufficient.
For performance reasons we should not reparse until the timestamp is changed.

FWIW I narrowed this check specifically for test decorations (https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/1371) but opted not to push the logic deeper down since, as we discussed, I was unsure if there would be undesired effects elsewhere.

While it's still somewhat fresh though, maybe we should consider adding this extra check to other use cases.

@devoncarew, @jwren : can you recall what motivated this issue?  

Can we enumerate other places where this more specific test would be useful?  A few quick thoughts:

  * [ ] project icon decorations
  * [ ] menu contributions
  * [ ] run configuration creation

Closing in favor of bugs tracking the specific cases.

See for example: #1441, #1444, and #1445.

As noted in https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/pull/1448#issue-268918487, @alexander-doroshko , @jwren : we'll want to make sure that the Dart Plugin is updated with a similar test in the appropriate places. üëç

title: in the 'is flutter module' check, we should also check the pubspec
